description: Dopamine Menu: Curated library of 50+ offline Micro-Actions to restore dopamine baseline and attention capacity

dopamine_menu.title: Drink Water (Hydration Reset)
dopamine_menu.description: Drink a full glass of water slowly. Notice the temperature, the sensation.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Fill a glass with cold water. Drink it slowly over 2-3 minutes. Focus on the sensation of hydration.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Mild dehydration impairs cognitive function and mood (Armstrong et al., 2012)

dopamine_menu.title: Rot for 5 Mins (Floor Time)
dopamine_menu.description: Lie on the floor. Do nothing. Exist. Let your nervous system decompress.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Lie flat on the floor (carpet, rug, yoga mat). Set a 5-min timer. Close your eyes or stare at the ceiling. No phone. Just be.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Parasympathetic activation through passive rest reduces cortisol (Dishman et al., 2000)

dopamine_menu.title: Glow Up (Skincare Ritual)
dopamine_menu.description: 5-minute skincare routine. Cleanser, moisturizer, whatever you have. Self-care as resistance.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Wash your face slowly. Apply products with intention. Look at yourself in the mirror—not to judge, just to see.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Self-care rituals improve self-esteem and reduce anxiety (Barber & Santuzzi, 2017)

dopamine_menu.title: Sonic Cleanse (Full Album)
dopamine_menu.description: Listen to one full album, start to finish. No skipping. Experience the arc.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Pick an album you love (or one you've been meaning to hear). Headphones on. Press play. No scrolling.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Deep listening activates reward pathways and reduces rumination (Koelsch, 2014)

dopamine_menu.title: Declutter One Drawer
dopamine_menu.description: Pick one drawer. Empty it. Keep what matters. Toss the rest. Control the chaos.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Choose one junk drawer. Remove everything. Wipe it clean. Return only what you actually use. Feel the clarity.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Physical organization reduces cortisol and improves focus (Roster & Ferrari, 2020)

dopamine_menu.title: Inbox Zero Sprint
dopamine_menu.description: 15 minutes. Archive, delete, or respond. Reclaim your digital space.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Set a timer for 15 min. Process emails ruthlessly: delete, archive, or 2-min replies only. Unsubscribe from 5 lists.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Email management reduces cognitive load and improves perceived control (Kushlev & Dunn, 2015)

dopamine_menu.title: Coffee Ritual (Slow Brew)
dopamine_menu.description: Make coffee slowly. French press, pour-over, whatever. No multitasking. Just this.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Grind beans. Boil water. Pour slowly. Smell it. Taste it. Notice the warmth. Be here.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Mindful consumption enhances sensory awareness and present-moment focus (Arch & Craske, 2006)

dopamine_menu.title: Box Breathing (4-4-4-4)
dopamine_menu.description: Inhale 4, hold 4, exhale 4, hold 4. Repeat 5 cycles. Reset your nervous system.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Sit or stand. Breathe in for 4 counts. Hold for 4. Breathe out for 4. Hold for 4. Repeat 5 times.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Box breathing activates parasympathetic response, reducing heart rate variability (Jerath et al., 2015)

dopamine_menu.title: Cold Face Plunge
dopamine_menu.description: Fill a bowl with ice water. Submerge your face for 30 seconds. Instant reset.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Fill a large bowl with cold water + ice. Take a deep breath. Dunk your face for 20-30 seconds. Repeat if needed.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Mammalian dive reflex reduces heart rate and activates vagal tone (Gooden, 1994)

dopamine_menu.title: Stretching Flow (8 Poses)
dopamine_menu.description: 8 stretches, 30 seconds each. No yoga mat required. Just move.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Neck rolls, shoulder shrugs, forward fold, cat-cow, quad stretch, hip circles, calf raises, spinal twist. Hold each 30 sec.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Brief stretching improves circulation and reduces muscle tension (Behm & Chaouachi, 2011)

dopamine_menu.title: Gratitude Dump (3 Things)
dopamine_menu.description: Write 3 things you're grateful for. By hand. No phone notes app.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Grab paper and pen. Write down 3 things from today that didn't suck. Be specific. Feel it.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Gratitude journaling increases well-being and reduces depressive symptoms (Emmons & McCullough, 2003)

dopamine_menu.title: Nature Stare (Window Time)
dopamine_menu.description: Look out a window for 5 minutes. Watch the sky, trees, people. No judgment. Just observe.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Find a window. Set a timer. Watch what's outside. Notice movement, light, weather. Let your mind wander.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Nature exposure reduces stress and improves attention restoration (Kaplan, 1995)

dopamine_menu.title: Freewriting (No Editing)
dopamine_menu.description: 10 minutes. Write whatever comes to mind. Don't stop. Don't edit. Purge the mental cache.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Set a timer for 10 min. Write continuously. If you get stuck, write 'I don't know what to write' until something comes.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Expressive writing reduces intrusive thoughts and improves emotional regulation (Pennebaker & Beall, 1986)

dopamine_menu.title: Power Nap (15-Min)
dopamine_menu.description: Set an alarm. Close your eyes. Drift. Wake refreshed. The ultimate biological hack.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Set a 15-min alarm. Lie down or recline. Close your eyes. Don't force sleep—just rest. Wake when the alarm rings.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Short naps improve alertness and cognitive performance without sleep inertia (Lovato & Lack, 2010)

dopamine_menu.title: One-Song Dance Break
dopamine_menu.description: Play one song. Dance badly. Move your body. No one's watching. Let it out.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Pick a high-energy song. Turn it up. Move however your body wants to move. No choreography. Just vibes.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Dance increases endorphins and reduces stress hormones (Quiroga Murcia et al., 2010)

dopamine_menu.title: Plant Check (Tend One Thing)
dopamine_menu.description: Water a plant. Wipe its leaves. Check the soil. Care for something alive.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Choose one plant. Check if it needs water. Remove dead leaves. Rotate it toward light. Touch the soil.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Plant care reduces stress and increases feelings of responsibility (Shibata & Suzuki, 2002)

dopamine_menu.title: Phone-Free Walk (10 Min)
dopamine_menu.description: Leave your phone. Walk for 10 minutes. Look at the world. Remember what it's like.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Leave your phone at home (or in a drawer). Walk outside. No destination. No podcast. Just walk.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Walking improves mood and creativity, especially without cognitive load (Oppezzo & Schwartz, 2014)

dopamine_menu.title: Meal Prep (One Dish)
dopamine_menu.description: Cook something from scratch. No delivery apps. Chop, stir, taste. Feed yourself.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Pick a simple recipe. Gather ingredients. Cook without looking at your phone. Taste as you go. Sit down to eat.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Cooking from scratch increases mindfulness and dietary quality (Wolfson & Bleich, 2015)

dopamine_menu.title: Cold Shower (2-Min)
dopamine_menu.description: End your shower with 1-2 minutes of cold water. Breathe through it. Feel alive.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Finish your normal shower. Turn the temp to cold. Stay for 1-2 min. Breathe slowly. Embrace the discomfort.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Cold exposure increases norepinephrine and dopamine, improving mood (Shevchuk, 2008)

dopamine_menu.title: Sun Salutations (5 Rounds)
dopamine_menu.description: 5 yoga sun salutation cycles. No experience needed. Just move with your breath.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Follow a 2-min tutorial if needed. Do 5 slow rounds. Sync movement with breath. Feel your body wake up.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Yoga reduces cortisol and improves parasympathetic tone (Ross & Thomas, 2010)

dopamine_menu.title: Brown Noise Bath (20 Min)
dopamine_menu.description: Lie down. Headphones on. Play brown noise. Let your brain defrag.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Find a comfortable position. Play brown noise (YouTube, Spotify, app). Close your eyes. Let the sound wash over you.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Low-frequency noise masks distractions and promotes relaxation (Soderlund et al., 2007)

dopamine_menu.title: Hand-Written Letter
dopamine_menu.description: Write a letter to someone. Anyone. By hand. Put it in an envelope. Mail it or don't.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Get paper and pen. Pick a recipient (friend, family, past self). Write 1-2 pages. Seal it. Feel the weight of analog connection.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Handwriting activates different neural pathways than typing, improving retention (Mueller & Oppenheimer, 2014)

dopamine_menu.title: Sensory Shower
dopamine_menu.description: Shower slowly. Notice temperature, sound, smell. No planning. Just sensation.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Step into the shower. Close your eyes. Feel the water. Listen to the sound. Smell the soap. Stay present.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Sensory mindfulness reduces anxiety and increases interoceptive awareness (Farb et al., 2007)

dopamine_menu.title: Doomscroll Antidote (Analog Read)
dopamine_menu.description: Read something physical for 15 minutes. Book, magazine, newspaper. Anything not backlit.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Pick up a physical book or magazine. Set a timer. Read without checking your phone. Notice the difference.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Print reading improves comprehension and reduces eye strain (Mangen et al., 2013)

dopamine_menu.title: Tea Ceremony (Slow Brew)
dopamine_menu.description: Make tea the slow way. Boil water. Steep properly. Sip without multitasking.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Choose loose-leaf or quality tea. Boil water to the right temp. Steep for the correct time. Sip slowly. Taste each note.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Tea rituals activate mindfulness and improve mood (Einöther & Martens, 2013)

dopamine_menu.title: Doodle Session (No Output)
dopamine_menu.description: Draw or doodle for 10 minutes. It doesn't have to be good. Just move the pen.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Grab paper and pen. Doodle anything: shapes, patterns, faces. No judgment. No Instagram post. Just create.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Doodling improves focus and memory retention (Andrade, 2010)

dopamine_menu.title: Scream into the Void (Pillow Therapy)
dopamine_menu.description: Grab a pillow. Scream into it for 30 seconds. Release what's stuck.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Find a pillow or cushion. Press it to your face. Scream as loud as you can for 20-30 seconds. Let it out.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Cathartic release reduces physiological arousal and anger (Bushman et al., 1999)

dopamine_menu.title: Laundry Meditation
dopamine_menu.description: Fold laundry slowly. Match socks. Smooth fabric. Turn a chore into presence.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Fold each item slowly. Notice texture, warmth, scent. Match socks like a puzzle. Make it meditative.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Mindful chores reduce stress and increase task satisfaction (Hanley et al., 2015)

dopamine_menu.title: Jump Rope (5 Min)
dopamine_menu.description: 5 minutes of jump rope. High intensity. Burn the static. Feel your heart.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Grab a jump rope (or imaginary one). Set a timer. Jump for 5 min (or as long as you can). Breathe hard.
dopamine_menu.research_note: High-intensity exercise rapidly increases endorphins and dopamine (Dishman & O'Connor, 2009)

dopamine_menu.title: Voice Note (No Typing)
dopamine_menu.description: Record a voice note to someone instead of texting. Hear yourself speak.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Open voice notes. Hit record. Say what you'd type. Send it. Feel the difference.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Voice communication conveys more emotional nuance than text (Kruger et al., 2005)

dopamine_menu.title: Bed-Making Ritual
dopamine_menu.description: Make your bed properly. Smooth the sheets. Fluff the pillows. Start the day with order.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Pull up sheets tightly. Smooth out wrinkles. Arrange pillows. Admire your work. Feel accomplished.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Small acts of order prime self-discipline throughout the day (Baumeister & Tierney, 2011)

dopamine_menu.title: Facial Yoga (5 Min)
dopamine_menu.description: 5 minutes of face stretches. Jaw release, eye circles, forehead smoothing. Your face holds tension too.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Massage temples, jaw, forehead. Open mouth wide, scrunch face, then relax. Circle eyes. Release the tension.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Facial muscle relaxation reduces tension headaches (Carlson & Hoyle, 1993)

dopamine_menu.title: Pushup Ladder (AMRAP)
dopamine_menu.description: As many pushups as you can do. No judgment. Feel your body work.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Get in plank position. Do as many pushups as you can with good form. Modified knee pushups count. Feel strong.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Resistance exercise improves self-efficacy and mood (Gordon et al., 2017)

dopamine_menu.title: Candle Stare (Trataka)
dopamine_menu.description: Light a candle. Stare at the flame for 5 minutes. Ancient meditation. Modern reset.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Light a candle. Sit 2 feet away. Stare at the flame without blinking (as long as comfortable). Breathe slowly.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Trataka meditation improves focus and reduces mental chatter (Prabhu et al., 2018)

dopamine_menu.title: Trash Purge (5 Things)
dopamine_menu.description: Find 5 things to throw away right now. Create space. Feel lighter.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Walk through your space. Find 5 things you don't need: old receipts, expired food, broken items. Toss them.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Decluttering reduces cortisol and improves mental clarity (Roster et al., 2016)

dopamine_menu.title: Barefoot Grounding (10 Min)
dopamine_menu.description: Take off your shoes. Stand on grass, dirt, or sand. Connect to the earth. Literally.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Find grass, sand, or dirt. Remove shoes and socks. Stand or walk barefoot for 10 min. Feel the ground.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Grounding reduces inflammation and improves vagal tone (Chevalier et al., 2012)

dopamine_menu.title: Playlist Curation (New Mix)
dopamine_menu.description: Create a new playlist. 10-15 songs. Theme it. Name it something real. Share it or don't.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Open your music app. Create a new playlist. Pick a theme or mood. Add 10-15 songs. Name it. Feel the curation.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Music curation activates identity expression and emotional regulation (Saarikallio, 2011)

dopamine_menu.title: Posture Reset (Wall Stand)
dopamine_menu.description: Stand against a wall for 2 minutes. Head, shoulders, butt, heels touching. Feel your spine align.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Find a wall. Stand with back against it. Touch: head, shoulders, butt, heels. Hold for 2 min. Notice your alignment.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Posture correction reduces pain and improves mood (Wilkes et al., 2017)

dopamine_menu.title: Snack Meditation (One Food)
dopamine_menu.description: Eat one snack mindfully. Smell it. Taste it. Chew slowly. No screens. Just food.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Pick one snack (fruit, nuts, chocolate). Sit down. Look at it. Smell it. Take small bites. Chew 20 times. Taste everything.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Mindful eating reduces overeating and increases satisfaction (Wansink, 2006)

dopamine_menu.title: Closet Donation (5 Items)
dopamine_menu.description: Find 5 items of clothing you haven't worn in a year. Bag them. Donate. Let go.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Open your closet. Pull out 5 items you don't wear. Put them in a bag. Schedule a donation drop-off. Feel the space.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Letting go of possessions reduces attachment anxiety (Roster & Ferrari, 2020)

dopamine_menu.title: Podcast Walk (Learning)
dopamine_menu.description: Walk outside while listening to one podcast episode. Movement + learning. Reclaim commute energy.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Pick an educational podcast (not doom news). Start walking. Listen to one full episode. Move your body while your mind expands.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Walking while listening improves information retention (Ericsson, 2008)

dopamine_menu.title: Love Language Action
dopamine_menu.description: Do something for someone in their love language. Text, gift, act of service. Connect IRL.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Think of someone you care about. Identify their love language. Do one thing: send a voice note, bring them coffee, help with a task.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Acts of kindness increase oxytocin and strengthen relationships (Curry et al., 2018)

dopamine_menu.title: Mirror Pep Talk
dopamine_menu.description: Look at yourself in the mirror. Say 3 kind things out loud. Mean it. Hear yourself.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Stand in front of a mirror. Look at your face. Say 3 nice things to yourself out loud. Hear your voice affirming you.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Self-affirmation reduces stress reactivity and improves self-compassion (Critcher & Dunning, 2015)

dopamine_menu.title: Meal-Time No-Phone
dopamine_menu.description: Eat one meal with your phone in another room. Just you and your food. Radical.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Before eating, put your phone in another room. Sit down. Eat slowly. Taste every bite. Notice when you're full.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Phone-free meals improve digestion and eating enjoyment (Oldham-Cooper et al., 2011)

dopamine_menu.title: Vitamin D Soak (Sun Bath)
dopamine_menu.description: Sit in direct sunlight for 10 minutes. No phone. Just sun. Let your body make vitamin D.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Find a sunny spot (window works too). Sit or lie down. Close your eyes. Feel the warmth. Breathe.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Sun exposure increases vitamin D and serotonin production (Penckofer et al., 2010)

dopamine_menu.title: Pet Hangout (10 Min)
dopamine_menu.description: Spend 10 minutes with a pet. Yours or someone else's. Pet them. Play. Be present.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Find a dog, cat, or any animal. Pet them slowly. Play with them. Watch them exist. Smile.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Animal interaction reduces cortisol and increases oxytocin (Beetz et al., 2012)

dopamine_menu.title: Progressive Muscle Relaxation
dopamine_menu.description: Tense and release each muscle group. Toes to head. 10 minutes. Release what you're holding.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Lie down. Tense your toes for 5 sec, then release. Move up: calves, thighs, core, arms, face. Notice the release.
dopamine_menu.research_note: PMR reduces anxiety and improves sleep quality (Toussaint et al., 2021)

dopamine_menu.title: Bookstore Wander
dopamine_menu.description: Visit a bookstore. Browse aimlessly. Touch books. Read first pages. Leave with one or none.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Go to a local bookstore. No list. Wander the aisles. Pick up books. Read back covers. Smell the pages. Buy or don't.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Analog browsing activates serendipitous discovery and reduces decision fatigue (Thudt et al., 2012)

dopamine_menu.title: Vent Journal (Uncensored)
dopamine_menu.description: Write everything you're angry about. No filter. Burn it after if you want. Purge it.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Grab paper. Write every frustration, fear, anger. Don't edit. Don't judge. When done, rip it up or burn it (safely).
dopamine_menu.research_note: Expressive writing reduces rumination and emotional reactivity (Sloan & Marx, 2004)

dopamine_menu.title: Silence Sit (No Input)
dopamine_menu.description: Sit in silence for 10 minutes. No music, no podcast, no sounds. Just you and your thoughts.
dopamine_menu.instructions: Find a quiet spot. Sit comfortably. Set a timer for 10 min. Close your eyes or soften your gaze. Just be.
dopamine_menu.research_note: Silence activates default mode network and promotes self-reflection (Kral et al., 2018)
